This skin is not available. Please check skin are available in /sdcard/org.jsharkey.sky/skins/ . Clear skin name box to use internal skin.\n\n Please donate at PayPal koxx3@free.fr to keep it free, thanks !
Communication problem with Google geocoder server. Retry in few minutes.
Provides forecast desktop widgets that refresh four times daily
THIS IS AN OLDER VERSION. NEWER VERSION IS AVAILABLE ON MARKET AS \"Weather forecast widget\" : http://market.android.com/search?q=pname:org.koxx.weather_forecast .
This is in order to respect original software creator job, i won't anymore use his name as package name.

Instead of "running" widgets, you add them to your home screen. To insert a widget, long-press in an empty area on the default home screen and select "Widgets", then "Forecast".

Tap on a widget to see detailed forecast for the next few days. Any inserted widgets will update automatically about four times each day, and no battery is used between updates.

You can also insert multiple widgets to keep track of weather in multiple locations.

Forecast can be manually (in details windows, click on title bar to request), or automatically (in configuration panel). Set 0h in configuration panel to avoid automatic update. If update fail (server error or internet connection problem), an asterix will appear in the upper right corner.

To change skin, you have to download skins ressource file from this website : http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?p=3954429, and uncompress this file to sdcard root. To set the skin, use widget configuration panel. To contribute, please post your skin at XDA.

These widgets were written as Android developer examples by Jeff Sharkey and released under the Apache 2.0 license. http://jsharkey.org

Forecast data is provided under a public domain license from the National Weather Service, a division NOAA. http://weather.gov

Forecast icons provided under a public domain license through the Tango Desktop Project. http://tango.freedesktop.org 

Modified by Koxx to use Google Weather instead of weather.gov, for international version !
